message.entry: The inputs must start with 0, 2, or 3 numerical arguments, followed by name-value pairs.
The ControlModel property must be set to use predict(obj, t, u).
Since the ControlModel property is set, you must use this syntax: predict(obj, t, u).
Expected MeasurementModel and StateModel to have the same number of columns.
Expected ControlModel and StateModel to have the same number of rows.
Expected StateModel to be a square matrix.
Expected z_matrix to be a vector of {0} elements or a matrix of {1} columns.
Expected {0} to be a scalar or {1}-by-{2} matrix.
Expected {0} to be a positive-semidefinite and symmetric matrix.
Expected State to be a scalar or a {0}-element vector.
The {0} property must be set when the object is constructed.
You must call the predict method prior to calling the distance method.
